description: Oksana Lintz submits a detailed advisory to the Council, urging a citywide three-week suspension of the BCI. She argues that a pause will let communities rebuild trust and encourages cooperative behavior, warning that immediate crackdowns could deepen unrest and permanently damage social cohesion.
After heated debate, Council narrowly votes to enact the 'social trust trial,' suspending all BCI scoring and compliance checkpoints, citing Oksana's risk assessment as a key factor.
Authorities announce the temporary citywide suspension of the BCI scoring system. Residents’ scores are frozen, and all digital checkpoints and compliance gates are deactivated for three weeks.

With BCI on hold, neighborhoods self-organize local councils to share resources, resolve disputes, and manage daily routines. Barriers between former high- and low-score residents erode, and civic cooperation spreads.

As the trial nears its end, heated discussions emerge over BCI’s future. Citizens and local leaders debate permanent self-governance versus reinstating the automated system. Factions within both Council and the city harden, signaling an uncertain path ahead.
